overview_of_class: A reading and writing course in short fiction. Students will read widely in traditional as well as experimental short stories, seeing how writers of different culture and temperament use conventions such as plot, character, and techniques of voice and distance to shape their art. Students will also receive intensive practice in the craft of the short story, writing at least one story, along with revisions, short exercises, and a critical study of at least one work of fiction, concentrating on technique.
name: Reading and Writing Fiction
title: WCAS ENGLISH 207-0-20 Reading and Writing Fiction

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: English 206. No P/N registration. Attendance of first class is mandatory. Course especially recommended for prospective Writing Majors. Literature Majors also welcome.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Discussion of readings and principles; workshop of student drafts.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Evidence given in written work and class participation of students' growing understanding of fiction; improvement will count for a great deal in estimating achievement.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Selected short stories, essays on craft, and the work of the other students.
